Well, we.
Approach to this challenged.

Some of the most important are definitely relatively low completion rates.
We know that on average only about 5 to 10% percent of MC participants actually finish complete the course and obtain the certificate.
So we asked ourselves while approaching to design our first MC.
How can we overcome some of these challenges?
And is it possible to take some of the principles that are working very well in our online learning courses?
To take them out and try to upgrade them into the MC context in the MC framework, and that's what we try to do within the within the framework of the destiny.
European project which was with May.

That was the key idea so.
A very thorough extensive background research was first conducted and we found out that it was the transversal skills, the soft skills that were the most crucial.
They were the ones that were that were that were lacking that were missing, so that they were insufficiently developed among the work seekers.

The team work assignment and then divided participants into into smaller groups of smaller teams.

The skill development.
